sentences: Jo Woo-chan (Korean: 조우찬; born January 20, 2005), is a South Korean rapper.
He released his first collaborative single, "OGZ", on January 5, 2018.
Woo-chan was born on January 20, 2005 in Seoul, South Korea.
Previously Woo-chan already had some experience of working as a child actor and model, filming commercials for a variety of brands.
At just 12 years old, Jo Woo-chan was the youngest participant in the history of Show Me the Money 6 and dubbed "Lil Dok2" in 2017.
As a guest, Jo featured on Hui's song "Wake me up" in KBS's pilot music variety show, Hyena on the Keyboard; the single was released on October 9 on Korean online music sites.
In October 2017, Jo was cast in the JTBC short film Father’s Sword by Director Jeong Yoon-cheol.
On January 5, 2018, Jo took part in a joint project group called OG School Project with Starship trainees Park Hyun-jin and Achillo, they released the song "OGZ", produced by GroovyRoom.
In July 2019, Jo made his departure from Cube Entertainment.
On January 8, 2022, Jo was revealed as a member of Big Hit Music's upcoming boy group with the tentative name Trainee A.
